alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 8:33PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Decatur County through 915 PM EDT... At 833 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greensburg, or 16 miles west of Batesville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Decatur County, including the following locations... Newpoint, Millhousen, Milford and Adams. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 129 and 143. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
